table.name: recreation_access
table.remarks: Recreation Resource Access types

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: Identification manually assigned to a Recreation Resource

column.name: access_code
column.remarks: Code identifying the type of access

table.name: recreation_access_code
table.remarks: Codes describing types of access to Recreation Resources

column.name: access_code
column.remarks: Code identifying the type of access

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the code value

column.name: sub_description
column.remarks: Additional description of the code value

table.name: recreation_activity
table.remarks: The types of available activities for a given project.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: File identification assigned to Recreation Resources. Assigned file number. Usually the Licence, Tenure or Private Mark number.

column.name: recreation_activity_code
column.remarks: Code describing the Recreation Activity.

table.name: recreation_activity_code
table.remarks: Activity code types for recreation projects.

column.name: recreation_activity_code
column.remarks: Code describing the Recreation Activity.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the code value.

table.name: recreation_agreement_holder
table.remarks: Identifies the Agreement Holder responsible for maintaining a project for a given time frame.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: File identification assigned to Provincial Forest Use files. Assigned file number. Usually the Licence, Tenure or Private Mark number.

column.name: client_number
column.remarks: Sequentially assigned number to identify a ministry client.

column.name: agreement_start_date
column.remarks: Start date of the agreement held between the ministry and the agreement holder.

column.name: agreement_end_date
column.remarks: End date of the agreement held between the ministry and the agreement holder.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A count of the number of times an entry in the entity has been modified. Used to validate if the current information displayed on a user's web browser is the most current.

table.name: recreation_control_access_code
table.remarks: Describes the Controlled Access Code for a rec resource. E.g. “Gated”, “Restricted Use”.

column.name: recreation_control_access_code
column.remarks: The Controlled Access Code for a rec resource. E.g. “Gated”, “Restricted Use”.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the Controlled Access Code for a rec resource.

column.name: effective_date
column.remarks: The effective date of the Controlled Access Code for a rec resource.

column.name: expiry_date
column.remarks: The expiry date of the Controlled Access Code for a rec resource.

column.name: update_timestamp
column.remarks: The update timestamp of the Controlled Access Code for a rec resource.

table.name: recreation_defined_campsite
table.remarks: A defined campsite is a camping area within a project designated by the Recreation officer. This may contain recreation structures.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: File identification assigned to Provincial Forest Use files. Assigned file number. Usually the Licence, Tenure or Private Mark number.

column.name: campsite_number
column.remarks: The number assigned to a defined campsite by Recreation staff.

column.name: estimated_repair_cost
column.remarks: Identifies the estimated remedial repair cost for a campsite.

column.name: recreation_remed_repair_code
column.remarks: Indicates the type of remedial repair applicable to the defined campsite.

column.name: repair_complete_date
column.remarks: Identifies the completion date for the campsite repair.

table.name: recreation_district_code
table.remarks: Recreation district codes for classification of areas within a project

column.name: district_code
column.remarks: A code indicating a recreation district boundary. EG Cascades, Chilliwack, Discovery Coast. Note: There are 17 Recreation District Boundaries, most of which have different geographical boundaries than Forest District Boundaries. Because of this, Rec District Boundary Codes are different from Forest District Boundary Codes.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the recreation district boundary type

table.name: recreation_driving_direction
table.remarks: Driving directions to a recreation resource for public display

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: Identification manually assigned to a Recreation Resource.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Descripption of the driving directions to a recreation resource for public display.

table.name: recreation_fee_code
table.remarks: Recreation fee codes for classification of fees within a project

column.name: recreation_fee_code
column.remarks: A code indicating a specific recreation fee type. E.g., C for Camping, D for Day Use, H for Hut.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the recreation fee type.

table.name: recreation_maintenance_standard_code
table.remarks: Codes describing the maintenance standards for recreation projects.

column.name: maintenance_standard_code
column.remarks: Code describing the Maintenance Standard of a given site. E.g. User Maintained, Maintained to Standard, Not Maintained.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the code value

table.name: recreation_map_feature
table.remarks: Captures both current and historical attributes for Recreation Map Features.

column.name: rmf_skey
column.remarks: The SKEY for the RECREATION MAP FEATURE.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: File identification assigned to Provincial Forest Use files. Assigned file number. Usually the Licence, Tenure or Private Mark number.

column.name: section_id
column.remarks: The section id for the RECREATION MAP FEATURE.

column.name: amendment_id
column.remarks: The amendment id for the RECREATION MAP FEATURE.

column.name: amend_status_code
column.remarks: Code to indicate status of amendment, that is, pending, approved or disallowed. This references Timber_Status_Code.

column.name: recreation_resource_type
column.remarks: Identifies the RECREATION MAP FEATURE TYPE CODE.

column.name: amend_status_date
column.remarks: The date the amendment status was changed.

column.name: retirement_date
column.remarks: The date the entry is retired.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A count of the number of times an entry in the entity has been modified. Used to validate if the current information displayed on a user's web browser is the most current.

column.name: recreation_map_feature_guid
column.remarks: Global Unique Identifier generated by the system for new records. It was added for FTA 5.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: The timestamp of the last update to the road section record.

column.name: updated_by
column.remarks: The userid of the individual who last updated this road section record.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Contains the system timestamp when data in a table was inserted.

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: The userid responsible for inserting data into a table.

table.name: recreation_map_feature_geom
table.remarks: Captures amendments to spatial geometry for recreation applications received via the electronic submission process.

column.name: rmf_skey
column.remarks: The SKEY for the RECREATION MAP FEATURE.

column.name: map_feature_id
column.remarks: A unique identifier to a version of a map object. This is very similar to the feature ID in INCOSADA except it was universally unique. If a new version of a cut block came in it would be assigned a new identifier.

column.name: geometry_type_code
column.remarks: Identifies linear or polygonal geometry types for a tenure application feature.

column.name: geometry
column.remarks: The geometry for this feature.

column.name: feature_area
column.remarks: Spatial feature area in hectares. This value is calculated.

column.name: feature_length
column.remarks: Spatial feature length in kilometres. This value is calculated.

column.name: feature_perimeter
column.remarks: Spatial feature perimeter in kilometres. This value is calculated.

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A count of the number of times an entry in the entity has been modified. Used to validate if the current information displayed on a user's web browser is the most current.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: The timestamp of the last update to the road section record.

column.name: updated_by
column.remarks: The userid of the individual who last updated this road section record.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Contains the system timestamp when data in a table was inserted.

column.name: created_by
column.remarks: The userid responsible for inserting data into a table.

table.name: recreation_remed_repair_code
table.remarks: Codes describing types of remedial repairs for recreation structures.

column.name: recreation_remed_repair_code
column.remarks: Indicates the type of remedial repair applicable to the defined campsite.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the code value

table.name: recreation_resource
table.remarks: Resource information relating to a recreational file. A recreation file can have only one resource. A recreation resource must be of type Site, Reserve, Trail, or Interpretive Forest.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: Identification manually assigned to a Recreation Resource.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of the Recreation Project.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Field notes related to a recreation site. e.g. A managed, 11 unit site with 2WD access, gravel beach launch and a small float. Watch for hazards on the lake. This column is for internal use and is not a description for public use.

column.name: closest_community
column.remarks: A text description generally describing the closest community or, for more isolated sites and trails, it could be a geographic feature to a recreation site or trail. e.g. VERNON, KELOWNA, PRINCE GEORGE.

column.name: district_code
column.remarks: A code indicating a recreation district boundary. EG Cascades, Chilliwack, Discovery Coast. Note: There are 17 Recreation District Boundaries, most of which have different geographical boundaries than Forest District Boundaries. Because of this, Rec District Boundary Codes are different from Forest District Boundary Codes.

column.name: project_established_date
column.remarks: The date when the recreation project was officially established or created.

column.name: control_access_code
column.remarks: Describes the Controlled Access Code for a rec resource. E.g. “Gated”, “Restricted Use”.

table.name: recreation_resource_access_count_view
table.remarks: Provides a list of access codes and counts of their associated recreation resources for use in the search filter menu.
table.viewSql: SELECT rac.access_code, rac.description AS access_description, COALESCE(count(DISTINCT ROW(ra.rec_resource_id, ra.access_code, ra.sub_access_code)), (0)::bigint) AS count FROM ((rst.recreation_access ra LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_access_code rac ON (((ra.access_code)::text = (rac.access_code)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_resource rr ON (((ra.rec_resource_id)::text = (rr.rec_resource_id)::text))) WHERE (rr.display_on_public_site = true) GROUP BY rac.access_code, rac.description;

table.name: recreation_resource_district_count_view
table.remarks: Provides a list of district codes and counts of their associated recreation resources for use in the search filter menu.
table.viewSql: SELECT rd.district_code, rd.description, COALESCE(count(DISTINCT r.rec_resource_id), (0)::bigint) AS resource_count FROM (rst.recreation_district_code rd LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_resource r ON ((((r.district_code)::text = (rd.district_code)::text) AND (r.display_on_public_site = true)))) WHERE ((rd.district_code)::text <> ALL ((ARRAY['RDQC'::character varying, 'RDRM'::character varying])::text[])) GROUP BY rd.district_code;

column.name: doc_code
column.remarks: Unique identifier for the document code

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the document code

column.name: ref_id
column.remarks: Unique reference identifier for the document

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: Recreation Resource ID

column.name: title
column.remarks: Title of the document

column.name: url
column.remarks: URL where the document can be accessed

column.name: doc_code
column.remarks: Foreign key reference to document code type

table.name: recreation_resource_reservation_info
table.remarks: Identifies the reservation information on the specific recreation resource.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: File identification assigned to Provincial Forest Use files. Assigned file number. Usually the Licence, Tenure or Private Mark number.

column.name: reservation_instructions
column.remarks: Reservation website instructions.

column.name: reservation_website
column.remarks: Reservation website if availiable.

column.name: reservation_phone_number
column.remarks: Reservation phone number if availiable.

column.name: reservation_email
column.remarks: Reservation email if availiable.

column.name: reservation_comments
column.remarks: Reservation comments if availiable.

table.name: recreation_resource_search_view
table.remarks: Provides a list of recreation resources and related data for use in the public site search page
table.viewSql: SELECT DISTINCT ON (rr.rec_resource_id) rr.rec_resource_id, rr.name, rr.closest_community, rr.display_on_public_site, rrtv.description AS recreation_resource_type, rrtv.rec_resource_type_code AS recreation_resource_type_code, st_setsrid(rsp.geometry, 3005) AS recreation_site_point, jsonb_agg(DISTINCT jsonb_build_object('recreation_activity_code', ra.recreation_activity_code, 'description', rac.description)) FILTER (WHERE (ra.recreation_activity_code IS NOT NULL)) AS recreation_activity, jsonb_build_object('status_code', rs.status_code, 'description', rsc.description, 'comment', rs.comment) AS recreation_status, jsonb_agg(DISTINCT jsonb_build_object('ref_id', ri.ref_id, 'caption', ri.caption, 'recreation_resource_image_variants', rv.variants)) FILTER (WHERE (ri.ref_id IS NOT NULL)) AS recreation_resource_images, rd.district_code, rd.description AS district_description, ac.access_code, ac.description AS access_description, jsonb_agg(DISTINCT jsonb_build_object('structure_code', rsc2.structure_code, 'description', rsc2.description)) FILTER (WHERE (rsc2.structure_code IS NOT NULL)) AS recreation_structure, CASE WHEN (EXISTS ( SELECT 1 FROM rst.recreation_structure_code rsc_1 WHERE (((rsc_1.description)::text ~~* '%toilet%'::text) AND (rsc_1.structure_code IN ( SELECT rst_1.structure_code FROM rst.recreation_structure rst_1 WHERE ((rst_1.rec_resource_id)::text = (rr.rec_resource_id)::text)))))) THEN true ELSE false END AS has_toilets, CASE WHEN (EXISTS ( SELECT 1 FROM rst.recreation_structure_code rsc_1 WHERE (((rsc_1.description)::text ~~* '%table%'::text) AND (rsc_1.structure_code IN ( SELECT rst_1.structure_code FROM rst.recreation_structure rst_1 WHERE ((rst_1.rec_resource_id)::text = (rr.rec_resource_id)::text)))))) THEN true ELSE false END AS has_tables FROM (((((((((((((rst.recreation_resource rr LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_resource_type_view rrtv ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (rrtv.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_activity ra ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (ra.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_activity_code rac ON ((ra.recreation_activity_code = rac.recreation_activity_code))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_status rs ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (rs.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_status_code rsc ON ((rs.status_code = rsc.status_code))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_resource_images ri ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (ri.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_site_point rsp ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (rsp.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN LATERAL ( SELECT jsonb_agg(jsonb_build_object('size_code', riv.size_code, 'url', riv.url, 'width', riv.width, 'height', riv.height, 'extension', riv.extension)) AS variants FROM rst.recreation_resource_image_variants riv WHERE (((riv.ref_id)::text = (ri.ref_id)::text) AND ((riv.size_code)::text = 'pre'::text))) rv ON (true)) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_district_code rd ON (((rr.district_code)::text = (rd.district_code)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_access ra1 ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (ra1.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_access_code ac ON (((ra1.access_code)::text = (ac.access_code)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_structure rst ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (rst.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_structure_code rsc2 ON ((rst.structure_code = rsc2.structure_code))) GROUP BY rr.rec_resource_id, rr.name, rr.closest_community, rr.display_on_public_site, rrtv.rec_resource_type_code, rsp.geometry, rrtv.description, rs.status_code, rsc.description, rs.comment, rd.district_code, rd.description, ac.access_code, ac.description;

table.name: recreation_resource_type_code
table.remarks: Codes describing types of Recreation Resources

column.name: rec_resource_type_code
column.remarks: Identifies the Recreation Resource Type Code

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the code value

table.name: recreation_resource_type_count_view
table.remarks: Provides a list of resource type codes and counts of their associated recreation resources for use in the search filter menu.
table.viewSql: SELECT rrtv.rec_resource_type_code, rrtv.description, COALESCE(count(DISTINCT rr.rec_resource_id), (0)::bigint) AS count FROM (rst.recreation_resource_type_view rrtv LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_resource rr ON ((((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (rrtv.rec_resource_id)::text) AND (rr.display_on_public_site = true)))) WHERE ((rrtv.rec_resource_type_code)::text <> 'RR'::text) GROUP BY rrtv.rec_resource_type_code, rrtv.description ORDER BY rrtv.description DESC;

table.name: recreation_resource_type_view
table.remarks: Provides a list of resource type codes and descriptions for recreation resources to be used as the source of truth for getting the recreation resource type code for a recreation resource for display on the public site. This was needed to mitigate bugs from junk data in the recreation map feature table as well as the request to show some recreation reserves as sites on the public site.
table.viewSql: SELECT rr.rec_resource_id, CASE WHEN ((rr.display_on_public_site = true) AND ((rmf.recreation_resource_type)::text = 'RR'::text)) THEN 'SIT'::character varying ELSE rmf.recreation_resource_type END AS rec_resource_type_code, rrtc.description FROM ((rst.recreation_resource rr LEFT JOIN ( SELECT DISTINCT ON (recreation_map_feature.rec_resource_id) recreation_map_feature.rec_resource_id, recreation_map_feature.recreation_resource_type, recreation_map_feature.amend_status_date FROM rst.recreation_map_feature ORDER BY recreation_map_feature.rec_resource_id, recreation_map_feature.amend_status_date DESC) rmf ON (((rr.rec_resource_id)::text = (rmf.rec_resource_id)::text))) LEFT JOIN rst.recreation_resource_type_code rrtc ON ((( CASE WHEN ((rr.display_on_public_site = true) AND ((rmf.recreation_resource_type)::text = 'RR'::text)) THEN 'SIT'::character varying ELSE rmf.recreation_resource_type END)::text = (rrtc.rec_resource_type_code)::text)));

table.name: recreation_site_description
table.remarks: Description of a recreation resource for public display

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: Identification manually assigned to a Recreation Resource.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of a recreation resource for public display.

table.name: recreation_site_point
table.remarks: Stores the location of a Recreation Site as a point geometry. The data is used to provide the public a map location of the Recreation Site.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: Identification manually assigned to a Recreation Resource.

column.name: geometry
column.remarks: A point geometry location represented by a single X,Y pair

column.name: revision_count
column.remarks: A count of the number of times an entry in the entity has been modified. Used to validate if the current information displayed on a user"s web browser is the most current.

table.name: recreation_structure
table.remarks: Information relating to a recreation site improvement in a recreational tenure. All improvements are human-made.

column.name: rec_resource_id
column.remarks: Identification manually assigned to a Recreation Resource

column.name: structure_code
column.remarks: Indicates the type of structure (human-made improvement)

table.name: recreation_structure_code
table.remarks: Codes describing the type of structure (human-made improvement) within a recreation project

column.name: structure_code
column.remarks: Indicates the type of structure (human-made improvement)

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the code value

table.name: recreation_sub_access_code
table.remarks: Codes describing the Recreation Sub Access types within a project.

column.name: sub_access_code
column.remarks: Code describing the Recreation Sub Access types.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the code value.

routine.name: gin_extract_query_trgm(text, internal, smallint, internal, internal, internal, internal)
gin_trgm_consistent(internal, smallint, text, integer, internal, internal, internal, internal)
gin_trgm_triconsistent(internal, smallint, text, integer, internal, internal, internal)
setup_temporal_table(schema_name text, table_name text)
update_if_changed()
upsert_timestamp_columns(schema_name text, table_name text, updated_at_only boolean DEFAULT false)
versioning()
